title: Noel Turnbull
text:
Oswald Graham Noel Turnbull (20 December 1890 – 17 December 1970) was an <a href="English%20people">English</a> <a href="tennis">tennis</a> player. He is best known for his gold medal in the men's doubles event (with <a href="Maxwell%20Woosnam">Maxwell Woosnam</a>) at the <a href="1920%20Summer%20Olympics">1920 Antwerp Olympics</a>.
Before <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> Turnbull worked at the family firm of ship-owners. During the war he served as a driver, and during the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Somme">Battle of the Somme</a> won the <a href="Military%20Cross">Military Cross</a>. In 1919 he had his first major tennis tournament, the <a href="Davis%20Cup">Davis Cup</a>. In 1921 he played again in the Cup and won the singles at the Portuguese Championships, but then disappeared from tennis for four years to focus on <a href="golf">golf</a>. In 1926 he returned to the Davis Cup, and in 1928 again won the singles at the Portuguese Championships.
